website_summaries.verdict: Powerful tiller comes ready to use with battery pack.
pros: Comes with one lithium ion battery, battery charger, and operating instructions
Covers 325 square feet with fully charged battery
Features adjustable handle and telescoping tube
Oscillating tines keep weeds from tangling
cons: This is the most expensive option
Do not purchase this model if you already have a compatible battery pack

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective garden tool...
customer_reviews.text: This little "egg-beater" garden took has become my new best friend. It loosens dirt adequately to about a 4" depth and keeps me off my aging knees. scoop the loose dirt out and go down another 4-5 inches. Great for planting or or loosening hard packed dirt. I have no strength in my right arm due to re-construction surgery on my shoulder and the tool is lightweight and makes me a rock star in my garden!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Hicks

customer_reviews.title: She gave it a try and was amazed. Another unit sold
customer_reviews.text: Black & Decker has come through again with this tool. We live in the mountains so the ground is rocky and hard. Not a problem for this unit. I did a spectacular job for its size and battery operation. I had a friend stop by yesterday to take a look at it after I told her how well it worked. She gave it a try and was amazed. Another unit sold.
customer_reviews.author: B. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardens
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of the best garden tools I have purchased in years. It is comparatively lightweight for me to handle easily (I am 66 years old). I have just used it this past two weeks to prepare several fall planting beds and if has preformed wonderfully. I bought an extra battery and while I can get a LOT of work done with one charge, the extra battery has kept me going till each job is done. Really helpful around the yard. Has never once stopped or become wrapped up in roots. Cleans pretty easily with the hose washing the tines.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A

customer_reviews.title: Good for light soils without too many weeds.
customer_reviews.text: It seems well built and has substantial mass to hold it in contact with the ground. OK for loose soil with a few weeds, but largely ineffective for heavy soils with a fair amount of weeds and grass to be cultivated. It is useful for my wife's flower beds that have lots of light potting mix blended into the soil and relatively few weeds. But did a poor job in the garden of clay soil with a moderate amount of weeds and grass -- I got out the tiller! Perhaps now that I have weeded the area well with the tiller, it may do better in keeping the weeds at bay!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oscillating not rotating
customer_reviews.text: This works well but doesn't spin completely. So, it doesn't break up roots and other debris. In garden beds, it works pretty quick. In normal packed soil, it will take much more time. Tip: You have to drag it towards you. Pushing it doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.author: MinorHinderence

customer_reviews.title: More Work Than Digging With a Shovel or Raking
customer_reviews.text: First, I have no idea why this is not available in 40V. Second, for me at least, it just did not work. I had to push it down into the dirt, i had to pull it out of the dirt, it took a long time, it was easier to go back to just using a shovel to turn the soil and then a rake.
customer_reviews.author: dennis doverspike

customer_reviews.title: Defective from the start
customer_reviews.text: The shaft was drilled backwards so it was impossible to attach the support handle properly. There is a notched piece that lines up with the notch handle to keep the handle in place. They would not line up unless the handle was upside down. I completely took the handle portion part thinking I could flip it around and it would line up. No such luck because the handle has an orientation that lines up with holes that were drilled on the wrong side. I was able to cobble together a solution to attach the handle but it was a huge hassle and took a lot of time. Don't bother with this one the quality control is lacking in the manufacturing
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R Cannon

customer_reviews.title: works for me, sort of...
customer_reviews.text: works relatively well for a garden with good light soil, a planted bed topped with decomposing wood mulch to keep young weeds from getting hold, or for slowing grass/weed creep into dry edges along planted beds. The detractors are correct: not great in hard soil, short battery life, gets clogged in wetter soil, product needs improvement. However, for maintaining weed free areas, it saves a little time but mainly saves muscle fatigue and getting down on my knees so often.
customer_reviews.author: Deb B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but one issue
customer_reviews.text: 5-star for the tool itself. It runs well and does what I want it to do which is lightly till topsoil to accept grass seed. My only issue so far is that one of the "tines" (tillers) snapped on the second use. This was under light-duty work conditions. I contacted the company and they are sending me out a replacement part. And so, I dinged the item two stars because one tine broke and it's going to take up to two weeks to get to me. Unfortunately I need the tool now.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little tiller
customer_reviews.text: No tools needed to assemble. Battery fully charged in about 3.5hrs from the box. Used it later that day. Makes me nervous because it kinda bogs down like a drill does, because it’s electric, but it’s a tough machine. I used it on already tilled soil, but it hasn’t been messed with for about a month, and it had taken in some heavy rain. Good for small garden maintenance! I’ve only used it once, but I hope it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyanne

customer_reviews.title: then the handle broke off so I was glad to see this
customer_reviews.text: I have the original one. Used it for 5+ years got sick and tired of waiting forever for charging, then the handle broke off so I was glad to see this. But there's something different about this one. The other one really dug into the dirt esp on a full charge but this one kinda feels like it's not fully charged even though it is. Eh. Not digging it (pardon the pun) What a shame : \ Newer item isn't always better as in this case. Darn it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Like it, don't love it
customer_reviews.text: Very good as far as aerating the soil but not so good for traditional tilling. The unit does not move through the soil but more penetrates in one spot the requires the use to lift it up and move it. It does the job but it is more time consuming than a rotary tiller for roughly the same cost. With that said, I am glad I bought it since my garden is a raised bed and is quite small and it works very well for my purposes, I don't think I would be happy with it if my garden was much larger.
customer_reviews.author: Denancy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The blades on this only move a couple of inches back and forth in a circular motion. This does not give a good tilling of the soil. It also does not go very deep, only about 3 inches. Due to both of these factors it is not very easy to use. To break up soil it is necessary to lift up the head and put it into the soil repeatedly, as opposed to moving through the soil. Because of the somewhat heavy weight of the head this becomes tiresome over time. I would not recommend this tool to anyone, there are hand tools that work better and are lighter and less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: jaemin33

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this tiller to do the weeding inside my greenhouse. Since I cannot use a gas powered engine. The way the tines rotate is better to do the close weeding of plants. Maneuverability is good. You can get very close to the plants without worrying about cutting them up. The battery can do my 40 foot wide greenhouse with power to spare. The tiller will not breakup clods of dirt (I have clay soil) without a good soaking first. I can see this unit would be good for someone with limited strength. but I can still weed faster with my hoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hand tiller
customer_reviews.text: We already have a smaller Black & Decker hand tiller so I know we will like it. But I think the manufacturer should change the instruction book my husband and I almost came to blows putting the pins in the tines it is not an easy job and one I would ever tackle again. You cannot get the pins on so the round part is tight against the part the tine goes on to is someone has been able to I would like to know how you did it. So it will work great but is a b**** to put together.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wintle

customer_reviews.title: Poor power!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my garden that was already tilled...I really expected more power from this..not much power at all. Am I keeping it...yes....why...not really sure. It will do some stuff as long as the area has been soaked. Not one of my favorite purchases for gardening...but it will be ok for some parts here and there. Honestly not worth the cost I paid...$99.00 plus tax. But like I said...I am going to keep it for areas already soaked. Hope this helps another gardener who was expecting more power.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Labeda

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with a charger???
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cultivator with the 3.0 amp battery. Also ordered a second 3.0 amp battery. It finally arrived without a charger. How can you cultivate without charged batteries? The order was just under $200 and I have to buy and wait for a charger to arrive just to use it. I am wishing I hadn't bought it.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Welch

customer_reviews.title: So, so...
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this in hope that it would help clear out my garden that is being overtaken with crabgrass... No dice. As far as stirring up the dirt around planted produce, with bare dirt only, works great. To clear out an actual area, not so much. Invest in an additional battery or three as they do not last long and this thing could be more powerful in my opinion. If you’re looking for something to clear out heavy vegetation that is not desired, this is not it. Buy a propane flame thrower for 40 bucks! Now, that works great!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Lee Wisenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, good for cultivating lighter soil.
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to assemble, only took a few minutes. It cultivates soil that is not too compacted well but any hard soil would need to be broken up before using this cultivator. Battery only lasts about 15 minutes of hard use. The size maneuvers around plants well. Happy I got this but need to purchase a more heavy duty tiller for more compacted soil/clay in our yard and garden. Good value for the price. Worth getting a second battery.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Zimmerlin

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help weeding in Florida sandy soil. It works quite well for me. The battery lasts a reasonable amount of time. A spare battery doesn’t cost that much and is nice to have on hand. I really hate weeding and always look for a power tool to help. This device will take out the shallow rooted weeds and breaks up the soil around the deeper ones to aid in pulling them. I’ve had good longevity with B&D rechargeable yard tools.
customer_reviews.author: Stan57Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Use a toothpick instead
customer_reviews.text: This machine doesn't have power to loosen anything but very loose soil. If one holds it down for weeks then it might have desired effect, much as you might make your way out of Alcatraz with a sharpened fork. It might impress neighbors and make you feel in charge.
customer_reviews.author: V. Raman

customer_reviews.title: Strong machine with a long-run time battery
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptic about this cultivator/tiller when I purchased it. If you have normal beds that are routinely worked, this little machine does a super job. If you have a bed that has not been cultivated for a few years, it will not dig up the compacted soil easily--especially if it has grass roots and/or weeds embedded; but if you turn the soil over, it will do a tremendous job completing the task. The best feature for me is it's lightweight and compactness.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy Moody

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: It is great at roughing up the surface to plant grass seed, either bare spots or in your grass. Good for turning a compost or weeding garden. Ideal to fluff up mulch that is compact. Now, it is not like a gas tiller that going to turn over 40 acres. It is ideal for doing the little jobs. If you have other Black and Decker tools and batteries, then this is well worth it. I have a hedge trimmer, reciprocating saw, extended hedge trimmer, Weed wacker & lawn mower pole saw, etc and all have done a real nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Used, very good was actually new, re-packaged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used from amazon warehouse. It was like new. As far as the tool goes, I used it to cultivate a spot to plant some garlic. I knew I might have some problems because we have been having quite a bit of rain lately and the soil was somewhat wet. I did have to clean the tool several times, but it worked well. I believe in drier soil, it will work even better.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Richards

customer_reviews.title: A Lightweight approach to weeding
customer_reviews.text: I have a tiller I use to prepare the ground for my garden. This battery powered "tiller" is no match for my gas powered tiller. It is, however, a competent cultivator to weed in close to plants. I have 2 other 20 volt B&D batteries that I use in this. I get about 20-25 minutes of use from each. If you had the more expensive, higher amperage battery, you could get a longer use time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Keppel

customer_reviews.title: Only good for loose soil
customer_reviews.text: Only good for loose soil. I bought this hoping I could get out of digging and turning turf/soil to repair pee spots from my dogs. It just can't handle it and also the dirt/grass gets tangled up in the tines. IE- It's quicker/more effective to just dig out those spots. Upside is that I got with the battery and I use that with my B&D string trimmer which I absolutely love. This would be good for an already dug garden where you need to mix in fertilizer or something along those lines. Don't expect more, you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Fergus

customer_reviews.title: If you want a tiller, don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: This was a pretty big disappointment. All the two heads do is go back and forth. Virtually of no value. I was hoping this would act more like a tiller and bring up the soil and weeds. Not even close. If the soil is damp it sticks to the heads and you have to pull the dirt off. It is of no value to a gardener Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great small cultivator
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my most used planting flower tools. It breaks up clumps of soil for planting and keeps weeds down between the flowers. It is not a rototiller, so don't expect to use it as one. I gave one to one of my sons and one of my daughters and they love them. My son uses his in his vege garden to break up the soil that he dug up with a shovel. This one is a replacement for an 18 volt one that got destroyed in a garage fire. That one was years old and still working well, so I expect many years from this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Junk not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. I bought it for the name, but sadly disappointed. I'm having to use for 10 minutes then recharge the battery. I shoulders just spent a few extra dollars and got a better one. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda S

customer_reviews.title: Battery only last about an hour...cheaper at lowes
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay...it loosens dirt pretty good, have to take a extra time on weeds...but the battery life is poor...I charged my battery a whole day before using it, again and used it in my garden twice and both times the battery died within 40mins and I saw this item at Lowe’s for about 65.00 bucks...so i do feel a little ripped off,I had higher hopes.😕🤷‍♀️ 3stars ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️
customer_reviews.author: K Binns

customer_reviews.title: Great for working in your garden!
customer_reviews.text: This tiller is really great for working in small gardens. I have clay dirt in my yard so I had to make sure that the ground had been softened up a bit! The best time to use it in my clay yard was a day or two after it rained. It does a great job of tilling the soil and being able to move around without a cord saved me a lot of steps.
customer_reviews.author: Cleo

customer_reviews.title: disapointed
customer_reviews.text: It may work, .... but not for me. Waste of money. Would not recommend or buy again. Had seen it demonstrated on one of the shopping channels and they must have been in a flower box with filler. Again. I like good reviews but this is as bad as the SunJoe products for summer or winter. Gave it two stars instead of one in case it is just me. No it should be a one star item. Nice color.
customer_reviews.author: nyla martens

customer_reviews.title: Would not be without this light weight wonder.
customer_reviews.text: Love my tiller. I had knee surgery and need something to till my garden. It is light weight, durable and strong enough to sit on my garden stool and turn over a bed. I have 200 sq ft of 4x4 raised beds and this is perfect for turning over the soil in the whole box or just a space between plants. I did need two batteries to turn it all areas 6 inches deep. Order a second battery for sure. Would not be without my tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Magruder

customer_reviews.title: Better have very soft ground
customer_reviews.text: This is not a tiller. It is a weeder. It will rock back and forth and dig up the weeds in your garden if your soil is very loose. Best to till it well first, apply mulch then use this for maintenance. Works decent for that. Light weight and battery lasts a long time. Better use it every day to keep the soil loose.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka Bartnik Heim

customer_reviews.title: Does an excellent job keeping the weeds at bay in the veggie garden
customer_reviews.text: It does a surprisingly good job keeping the weeds under control. I bought the unit without the battery, and then bought a generic 4aH battery on ebay for a very cost effective solution. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: 55Trucker

customer_reviews.title: It’s OK but it could be sharper to get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: It does not dig like I expected it to but it is OK. I wanted to grab up grass around delicate flowers and it did not do that. I think if I stay in there long enough it would have. I am a little disappointed but I can use it for other work in the yard. I think if the blades are sharp, it would give me the desired results. Easy and convenient to use though.
customer_reviews.author: Annette M.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT COME WITH A BATTERY!
customer_reviews.text: I got all excited to receive my new gardening toy only to find out I can't use it because it did not come with a battery or charger! BUYER BEWARE! This is not noted in the sales add.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for raised garden beds
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this garden cultivator in 2017 and it's still running great. I use this for soil prep in raised garden beds every spring and don't know what I'd do without it. It's very lightweight, easy to use and durable. The batteries from 2017 are still working great, last for many hours and charge relativity fast. Highly recommended for raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fun and fulfilling to use
customer_reviews.text: My husband got me this tiller to break up soil in my flower beds where it would be difficult to use a larger rototiller. It's super easy to use, lightweight works surprisingly well considering the simplicity of the blade design, and holds a charge for longer than I need. In other words, I tire of tilling, long before the battery conks out. The best part is I can easily grab it and till up a small area without having to worry about electric cords, gas, or lugging around a large rototiller.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Lary

customer_reviews.title: Good Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: I chose 4 stars because I have not used it extensively. It is as advertised. I have found the battery stays charged longer than some of the reviews I read before purchasing. The first project I used it for was to prepare a 5' X 6' bed for an assortment of spring flowers. It mixed the existing soil with the Miracle Grow I used. The plants are beautiful. A job well done the the tiller. I would recommend it to anyone with small tasks, as it eliminates a lot of physical labor. The tool does the work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiller is tops!
customer_reviews.text: This tiller was quick and easy to assemble. Came with battery. I put to work right away and it operates as described. Meant for light to medium tasks. I have a rear tine tiller and that does the heavy work. I am using this tiller to loosen soil close in to plants and flowers. I am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not good for weeds
customer_reviews.text: Since it just oscillates back and forth, it loosens the soil around the weed, but unless you're going to go back and rake them up (and if you are you might as well just use a hoe from the start) they don't die and will come back. It's a fairly pointless tool. Either use an old fashion hoe or get an actual tiller (there are plenty of battery powered roto-tillers now).
customer_reviews.author: Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Good Tiller Not So Good Weeder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to reach under trees and plants to dislodge weeds and rake them out. The tines don't reach far enough into the soil to reach the roots on dandelions and horsestails. This is a good tiller for vegetable or flower gardens but definitely not a good weeder.
customer_reviews.author: TDM

customer_reviews.title: Dogs killing your lawn? You need this.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have found this years ago. I have dogs and you know how they kill lawns. This thing makes it a breeze to prepare dead spots for seed. I am using it with just one blade since it is the perfect size for the dead spots in the lawn. Bravo B&D!
customer_reviews.author: A. Marth

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Blades bent when attempting to loosen soil. Also, the battery only seems to last about 10 mins. I contacted Amazon for help however as my purchase was made in June 2020 they will not authorize a return. Guess I am stuck with this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer_66

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 25 minutes, then needs 8 hours to recharge the battery.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, ease of use, etc. BUT, the fully charged battery lasted for 25 minutes and will now take 8 hours to fully charge again. I was using it in pretty loose but weedy soil and got about 35 square feet done. Will be returning it for something with better, stronger batteries.
customer_reviews.author: QOTU

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It does not have much power. The lynch pin holding the blades in place fell out in the dirt after about 15 minutes of use. Just not worth it unless you already have some very loose soil already. But that does not explain the pin falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cultivator.
customer_reviews.text: After using it several times, glad I got it. Bought it mainly to clean flower beds, does a good job. It pulls some of the weeds out but mainly loosens the soil so weeds are much easier to pull up. Definitely worth the money and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Low budget efficient lightweight design
customer_reviews.text: Easy tool and lightweight design. Very flexible when teaching my young daughter (8) how to plant shrubs and flowers. I demonstrated once then allowed her to try. She loved it and due to light cordless design she was able to help efficiently. Big fan of Black & Decker 20V/40V universal tool batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Spiffy

customer_reviews.title: This works really well
customer_reviews.text: I did not think this tiller would work as well as it does with such a small battery, I got it for my dad who is in his 80 and still likes to garden, because it is light weight and a small tiller. He uses it every day I think, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: GOOD TOOL FOR RAISED GARDEN
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition for anyone who does small raised garden beds. It breaks up clumps of dirt easily. It's perfect for my 4' x 8' beds.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this for working in my flower bed! It would have been 5 stars, but I took one off because a tine broke the first time I used it. Finding the replacement part was a pain, and when I tried to use the customer service chat on their website it didn’t work. Luckily my husband found replacements on Amazon on his own, so I’ll be able to keep using my tiller!
customer_reviews.author: not_a_bunny

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It makes reworking my established garden plots a breeze without the effort of raking. It works well for small areas and churns up the soil really well. It also helps to keep the weeds in check in between the rows. Charges fairly quickly, is fairly light, easy to assemble and powerful enough for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Shayleia

customer_reviews.title: Light for a rototiller.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool, I am a female and I can handle this easily. If you need to rototill a small are like for a plant/flower/bulb, and you have hard ground, this is your machine. You can use both circular blades or just one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it's easy to use. Doesn't cut weeds, but, loosens the dirt around them, Making it easier to remove them. Great for listening ground around growing plants, an Small enough to maneuver around and between plants Locve ir
customer_reviews.author: Susan  Kitt

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: Even though we have a gardener my husband uses this because he says it’s fun, quick and easy. He just likes to play with it lol. The batteries are easy enough to find at a local store if needed so that is nice and they are interchangeable with other items in this same line.
customer_reviews.author: Jon's Wife (2009)

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: i was hoping for more. it mostly just agitates the dirt if bare ground. if you drag it around, it works better. going thru some grass, it didn't rip it out just dethatched it really really well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Save your hands.
customer_reviews.text: This is saving my hands! I already had surgery on my right hand from weeding too much. It does a great job of wiggling out the weeds with total roots. Does break up clay soil but you do have to go slow. Also ordered another battery so it doesn't run out of power before I finish the task of weeding my entire garden. Love the spring loaded battery to get it on and off with ease. The trigger to keep it going is comfortable and doesn't seem to fatigue your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Weinstock

customer_reviews.title: barely moves dirt
customer_reviews.text: If you have potting soil fresh in your garden, this might move the dirt around a bit. If you have anything other than that fluffy stuff, this isn't going to move much at all. This thing is pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Well done B&D
customer_reviews.text: This light weight, powerful tiller works very well in our small garden. I've used largfer tillers in the past, but this one does the job in our clay soil! So, no more big guys for me!
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This makes gardening so much easier for me. I didn't want to have to pay someone to till or plow a small plot for me to use as a garden spot. This tool allows me to do all the work and the battery lasts a good while. It's not to heavy and while it does take a little longer than a traditional tiller it does the same job.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for small areas
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it a four star is that I have only used it once. When working with soft dirt, it is great. It is really hard to penetrate hard soil or clay soil. Overall, I like the Black and Decker brand, therefore, I would think I will get good use of this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its just... meh.
customer_reviews.text: Great for tearing up a small layer of dirt, but doesn't do what it's designed for. I'll try it in the future, but when the ground was slightly dry, nothing seemed to be productive.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Back saver!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom who has a fairly large garden, about 40 by 30, she has a bad back and fell in love with this thing, it's accurate good battery life, its not going to break new ground though, we roto till at the beginning of the year after that this is the perfect little guy
customer_reviews.author: Dukker

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating to assemble. A modification was necessary. It is light weight and handy and easy to operate. Wish it had more power. Glad I got it but it will not be used a often as I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Gene A. Staver

customer_reviews.title: Great for specific jobs
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is great for specific small jobs around the yard. If you are buying this to plow the lower 40, you will be disappointed but for breaking up soil that was previously cultivated and working in fertilizer, this is a very convenient tool. I love the freedom that the battery provides. I am done with long extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: R F Barchiesi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I didn't expect it to work so well. My 10' X 20' garden was full of weeds and roots and rocks because I haven't planted for a couple of years. This little thing tilled it beautifully. I had to swap out batteries and let them recharge a couple of times, but this is 1000 times better than my hoe and shovel. I also have the Black and Decker weedeater and leaf blower that uses the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Green

customer_reviews.title: Not to till up large spaces if you have clay soil
customer_reviews.text: The clay gets clogged in the tines and you find yourself removing it every few minutes. It is good for planting bulbs etc but don’t expect it to work like a true tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn J. Field

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. These Lithium batts are the way to go. Charging-Shelf-life is around a year. My vegetable garden/raised beds need cultivation 2x a year, and this gets down into my soil and works it well. It has cut-back my spring prep time in the garden by 80%; has saved by back, too. No more pain becuase I can use it standing upright. Eats up the weeds, dislodges the start-up weeds, preps soil perfectly for my seedlings and seeds. Can't wait to use it in the fall when I spread my leaves over the beds ... will work them into the soil so they can be ready to feed my veggies next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie G.

customer_reviews.title: Best Rototiller I ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Its so light a light weight can use this easily. Women rejoice. I did the whole back yard in under 2 hrs. And my arms didn't feel like they were falling off. Perfect, light weight and super rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette R. Staffey

customer_reviews.title: Beware - NO Charger in the box!
customer_reviews.text: This works beautifully and was easily handled by myself, a 77 year old woman. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is the fact that the battery did not come with a charger, which was a big surprise to me! I worked in my vegetable garden for about 20 minutes and the battery lost it's charge! Job unfinished! Very disappointed I had also been looking at the re-furbished unit that does come with a battery and a charger, this must have confused me when I ordered the new unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kedala

customer_reviews.title: Keep your hands away from the blades 🤘🏻Lol
customer_reviews.text: Right away I tried it on my garden and was really impressed by the way it loosens the dirt around my vegetable plants. I showed a friend at work and he ordered one for his wife.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: good for light work
customer_reviews.text: I really like using this on the existing parts of my garden. It's lightweight and easy to handle. Sadly, it isn't strong enough to cultivate a new space to expand my garden. It's great so far, but I would probably rent a larger tiller or pay someone to help me expand next spring.
customer_reviews.author: redheaddebate

customer_reviews.title: Worth it--if it's what you need
customer_reviews.text: Very good for my needs. I have a very small garden. Use it between rows to take out weeds. Would not really do to create new garden space--at least not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Aine O'brocken

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest thing since sliced bread. I used tithe first time for less than half an hour and was able to loosen all the soil where my sod was going. It shreds the weeds so easily, and it even cuts smaller tree roots. I used it again to plot out a garden area. Once again, it decimated weeds, plant roots of previous crops and aerates the soil. Just pull the trigger and jam down into the soil. The unit is also light and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Carleton

customer_reviews.title: I do better job with my bare hands!
customer_reviews.text: This is like a joke! I do better job with my bare hands!
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinion

customer_reviews.title: It is very lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little tiller. You do need to have the ground prepared first and then use this more for weeding. It is very lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mom, Mammy

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for us
customer_reviews.text: We use the tiller for light work. Mainly beginning of spring and end of fall to till/cultivate our vegetable plots. The work is light and the soil is loosely packed. So, for our use, it is perfect. Gets the work done.
customer_reviews.author: der Grosse F

customer_reviews.title: IT DOES AREATE THE GROUND
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS DIFFICULT TO PUT THE PINSIN PLACE TO SECURE THE BLADES AND THE BLADES WIGGLE ALOT BUT THE JOB GETS DONE . AND IT BEATS GETTING DOWN ON YOU KNEES.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for soft soil!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this in the hopes that it would make it easier to get weeds out of the garden but I have clay soil so unless I watered the area I was working on it would just scrape the top of the surface. Great if you have nice loamy soil. Have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne B

customer_reviews.title: Made planting my garden easy!
customer_reviews.text: I already had other tools that use the same batteries, so decided to add this to my collection. It proved its value already as I planted my garden, created new flowerbeds, and added to other plants around my place.
customer_reviews.author: Monica B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do heavy tilling. Worked ground best.
customer_reviews.text: Does (fresh) 2 plots of 6'x6' loosened ground on one charge. Charge takes 2+ hours. Strong for its size. Handy in closed quarters. Easy to use but be gentle.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing. I am a 65 year old woman and this is exactly what I needed to mix the soil for a small vegetable garden. The battery lasted way longer than I expected. It made it for 2+ thorough passes of a 15X3 ft space. I would highly recommend this to anyone with the need for a small rototiller.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni L Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Blades are vertical.
customer_reviews.text: The blades Point down and rotate around a vertical axis unlike other tiller with horizontal axis. the downward blades are perfect for planting single plants also work well for making rows.
customer_reviews.author: Roy B

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much works as advertised. It will dig in compact soil you just have to be patient. It's not a rototiller but a terrific cultivator. Cuts weeding time by 75%. The blades do clog up in damp clay like soil but otherwise a terrific tool. It's better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: David  E

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver for Cultivating
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cultivate a flower bed in the front of my house and it did a good job. The soil was somewhat dry at the time but the cultivator had no problems. The only problem is that grass and weeds do have a tendency to get tangled around the blades fairly easily although they are easy to remove. The battery did well although the total area I did was only about 100-120 square feet. I do have a second battery from a Black and Decker hedge trimmer. It was also comfortable to use as the handle adjusted very easily. Overall seems good for light to medium duty work.
customer_reviews.author: John Sapovits

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: Works okay but it does not mix the soil. It does work the soil for loosing it up and provides space for oxygen. It is an okay machine but I did have to go back with a shovel to mix the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Wells

customer_reviews.title: Performs Nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I already had two batteries to fit this device, so it was nice to save a little cash to buy this without the battery. I am using this to loosen soil in landscaping in front of the house. This works well to break up soil in areas where a tiller would be overkill.
customer_reviews.author: Colin M.

customer_reviews.title: I have several large garden boxes (10'X20') and this baby tills them very nicely. The only problem is that it does run ...
customer_reviews.text: This little guy actually does the trick for a small garden. I have several large garden boxes (10'X20') and this baby tills them very nicely. The only problem is that it does run out of juice within an hour, but pop for an extra battery and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Idagirl

customer_reviews.title: Use for only loose soil
customer_reviews.text: The blades are of very light weight material with no sharpened edges for cutting into soil. It works well for loose soil but not sturdy or sharp enough to penetrate packed or clay type soils. Very useful for flower beds but not much else.
customer_reviews.author: James Ouzts

customer_reviews.title: Light weight easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite toy! I went through 3 batteries the first time I used it because I had so much crabgrass in my vegetable garden. This was easy to get close to my plants without damaging them. I love how light weight it is
customer_reviews.author: NeBirdLady

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes after reading the reviews, but I have to say I am very disappointed. The tines only turn slightly back and forth, like a scratching motion. So be prepared to Turn your soil over before trying to use this, otherwise, it is just okay to just trying to rough up the dead spots in grass for reseeding prep! But BEWARE, the Battery runs out QUICK, and takes a stupid amount of time to charge...hours. It really should be sold with two batteries for any use.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: Aerated top soil about 2 inches.
customer_reviews.text: Probably would have removed some of my weeds in the garden if weeds weren’t so tough. It will work on shallow sandy soil, if no weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Does not really till soil as I had anticipated. Have to lift and move, does not travel through the soil with ease. Does not really mix the soil, particularly in weedy or grassy locations.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about a month and just about wore it out already. This is so easy to operate and does a great job. Makes weeding the flower beds a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Jankowske

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok, I guess
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, but if you live in the Pacific Northwest in a place that the soil is mostly rocks, this is not very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Dirt clumps up between the tines
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay, but if the dirt is at all moist it will clump up between the tines forcing you to constantly dig it out until you give up and go back to using a hoe or small electric tiller. A lot of money for a mediocre tool if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a tiller
customer_reviews.text: This is a dirt stirrer, nothing more. The rotary action just moves the dirt around and relocates any weeds, it doesn't pull them up at all. It's pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Wrench

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS BEASTLY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PLAN on going fast but this thing can get A LOT DONE!! Highly recommend this item in general for digging weeds and softening ground for grass seeding. Battery will need swapped out ever 30 min or so BUT this thing will get a lot done in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. Easy to assemble and works well on cultivated ground. I love it in my garden. Not so much in an older flower bed that needed to be severely cultivated. Battery worked well and provided adequate work time.
customer_reviews.author: Elcid 76

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Tiller (LGC120AM)
product_meta.description:
Style:20V Cultivator/Tiller KitIdeal for cultivating garden beds, weeding, and more, this battery-powered cultivator can cultivate up to 325 feet on a single charge. Counter-oscillating tines prevent weeds from tangling. Included Components: LGC120 Garden Cultivator, (1) LBXR20 20V MAX* Lithium Ion Battery, (1) LCS120 Smart Charger, (2) Tines

AMAZON.COM


The cordless LGC120 garden cultivator/tiller (view larger). Get the power you need with Black & Decker's 20-volt lithium system (view larger). Ideal for cultivating garden beds, landscape beds, and weeding, the Black & Decker LGC120 cordless garden cultivator/tiller easily breaks up soil to allow water and nutrients to reach plant roots. It's also great for prepping dry spots in lawn for seeding plus existing beds for planting. The two long tines are small enough to maneuver in between plants and counter-oscillating tines prevent weeds from tangling.

The telescoping shaft adjusts for the perfect length, allowing you to operate it standing up without bending over. This upright design combined with the comfortable grips and an adjustable auxiliary handle means that you can work longer without over-taxing muscles and joints.

This cultivator is powered by a 20-volt MAX lithium-ion battery that offers a longer lifespan and retains its charge 5x longer than similar 18-volt NiCad batteries--and you won't be limited by an extension cord. It's compatible with the full line of Black & Decker's 20-volt MAX line of power and gardening tools. You'll be able to cultivate up to 325 square feet per charge. The battery is also designed with 50 percent less battery weight, and the unit weighs a total of 8.1 pounds with battery installed.

The included Energy Star-qualified charger will charge a fully depleted battery in about 8 hours. You can also swap the battery among your other Black & Decker cordless lawn tools that are compatible with 20-volt MAX lithium-ion batteries. It's backed by a two-year limited warranty.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
LGC120 20-volt MAX lithium-ion cordless garden cultivator/tiller; LBXR20 battery; LCS20 battery charger; operating instructions

ABOUT BLACK & DECKER
Since 1910, Black & Decker has been setting the standard for innovation and design of power tools, accessories, outdoor yard care equipment, home cleaning products, automotive and lighting products, hardware, and other home improvement products. The inventor of the first portable electric drill with pistol grip and trigger switch, Black & Decker has evolved from a small machine shop in Baltimore, Maryland to a global manufacturing and marketing powerhouse with a broad line of quality products used in and around the home and for commercial applications. When users need to get work done, they trust Black & Decker for the products that will do the job efficiently and reliably. 

LGC120 CORDLESS GARDEN CULTIVATOR/TILLER
KEY FEATURES
 * Ideal for cultivating garden beds, landscape beds and weeding
   
   
 * 20-volt MAX lithium-ion battery provides longer battery, life year after year
   
   
 * Counter-oscillating tines prevent weeds from tangling
   
   
 * Lightweight upright design helps lessen arm fatigue while cultivating
   
   
 * Adjustable handle and telescoping tube; soft-grip handle
   
   
 * Weighs 8.1 pounds 
   
   
 * Energy Star rated 
   
   
 * Backed by a 2-year limited warranty


Counter-oscillating tines prevent weeds from tangling (view larger). 
Adjustable handle and telescoping tube (view larger). 
Soft grip handle provides added comfort (view larger).
feature_bullets: Powerful transmission with dual tines break up soil to allow water and nutrients to reach plant roots
Powered by 20-volt MAX lithium-ion battery, with longer lifespan and charge retention than NiCad batteries
Cultivates up to 325 square feet per charge
Counter-oscillating tines prevent weeds from tangling
2-year limited warranty; includes battery and Energy Star-qualified charger

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,006 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
